questions.title: Bead on Rotating Hoop
questions.statement: A bead of mass m is threaded on a frictionless circular hoop of radius R. The hoop rotates with constant angular velocity ω about a vertical diameter. Find the angle θ at which the bead can remain in stable equilibrium relative to the hoop.

questions.title: Rod on Rotating Table
questions.statement: A uniform rod of length L rotates in a horizontal plane with constant angular velocity ω about a vertical axis passing through one of its ends. A bead of mass m can slide without friction along the rod. At what distance r from the axis will the bead be in equilibrium?

questions.title: Disc Rolling on Incline
questions.statement: A disc of mass M and radius R rolls without slipping down an inclined plane of angle α. Find the acceleration of the disc and the minimum coefficient of friction required to prevent slipping.

questions.title: Block on Accelerating Wedge
questions.statement: A wedge of mass M and angle α rests on a frictionless horizontal surface. A block of mass m is placed on the wedge. What horizontal acceleration must be given to the wedge so that the block does not slide down? Assume all surfaces are frictionless.

questions.title: Three Block System
questions.statement: Three blocks of masses m₁ = 1 kg, m₂ = 2 kg, and m₃ = 3 kg are connected by strings and placed on a horizontal frictionless surface. A force F = 12 N is applied on m₃. Find the tension in the string connecting m₁ and m₂.

questions.title: Circular Motion with Friction
questions.statement: A car moves on a horizontal circular road of radius r with speed v. The coefficient of friction between the tires and road is μ. What is the maximum speed at which the car can take the turn without skidding?

questions.title: Spring Block System
questions.statement: A block of mass m is attached to a spring of spring constant k. The block is pulled a distance A from equilibrium and released. Find (a) the maximum velocity of the block, (b) the velocity when the block is at distance A/2 from equilibrium.

questions.title: Variable Force Work
questions.statement: A particle moves along the x-axis under the action of a force F = (6x² - 4x) N, where x is in meters. Calculate the work done by the force as the particle moves from x = 0 to x = 2 m.

questions.title: Loop-the-Loop
questions.statement: A small block slides down a frictionless track from height h and enters a circular loop of radius R. What is the minimum height h such that the block completes the loop without losing contact with the track?

questions.title: Satellite Orbital Velocity
questions.statement: A satellite is orbiting Earth at a height h above the surface. Given Earth's radius R and surface gravity g, derive the orbital velocity and period of the satellite.

questions.title: Escape Velocity
questions.statement: Derive the expression for escape velocity from Earth's surface. Calculate the escape velocity if the radius of Earth is 6400 km and g = 10 m/s².

questions.title: Electric Field of Ring
questions.statement: A uniform ring of charge Q and radius R lies in the xy-plane centered at the origin. Find the electric field at a point P on the z-axis at distance z from the center. At what value of z is the field maximum?

questions.title: Capacitor Network
questions.statement: Four capacitors of capacitance 2 μF, 3 μF, 4 μF, and 6 μF are connected in a network. Find the equivalent capacitance between points A and B when: (a) all are in series, (b) all are in parallel, (c) 2 μF and 3 μF in series, then parallel with 4 μF and 6 μF in series.

questions.title: Wheatstone Bridge
questions.statement: In a Wheatstone bridge, three resistances P, Q, and R are connected in the three arms and the fourth arm has unknown resistance S. When the bridge is balanced, what is the value of S in terms of P, Q, and R? If P = 100 Ω, Q = 10 Ω, and R = 400 Ω, find S.

questions.title: RC Circuit Charging
questions.statement: A capacitor C is charged through a resistor R by a battery of voltage V. Derive the expression for charge on the capacitor as a function of time. What is the time constant? After how many time constants does the capacitor reach 99% of full charge?

questions.title: Magnetic Force on Current Loop
questions.statement: A rectangular current loop of dimensions a × b carrying current I is placed in a uniform magnetic field B perpendicular to the plane of the loop. Calculate the net force and net torque on the loop.

questions.title: Gas Molecular Speeds
questions.statement: For an ideal gas, derive the expressions for (a) most probable speed, (b) average speed, and (c) RMS speed. Show that v_rms > v_avg > v_mp.

questions.title: Carnot Engine Efficiency
questions.statement: A Carnot engine operates between temperatures T₁ = 600 K and T₂ = 300 K. Calculate (a) the efficiency of the engine, (b) the work output if 1000 J of heat is absorbed from the hot reservoir, (c) the heat rejected to the cold reservoir.

questions.title: Adiabatic Process
questions.statement: One mole of an ideal gas (γ = 1.4) expands adiabatically from volume V to 2V. If the initial temperature is T, find the final temperature and the work done by the gas.

questions.title: Lens Combination
questions.statement: Two thin lenses of focal lengths f₁ = 20 cm and f₂ = -10 cm are placed in contact. Find the focal length of the combination. If an object is placed 30 cm from this combination, where is the image formed?

questions.title: Young's Double Slit
questions.statement: In Young's double slit experiment, the slits are separated by 0.5 mm and the screen is 1 m away. Light of wavelength 600 nm is used. Calculate (a) the fringe width, (b) the position of the 5th bright fringe from the center.

questions.title: Photoelectric Effect
questions.statement: Light of wavelength 400 nm is incident on a metal surface with work function 2.0 eV. Calculate (a) the maximum kinetic energy of ejected electrons, (b) the stopping potential, (c) the threshold wavelength.

questions.title: Bohr Model Energy Levels
questions.statement: Using the Bohr model, calculate (a) the radius of the first orbit of hydrogen, (b) the energy of the electron in the ground state, (c) the wavelength of the photon emitted when the electron transitions from n=3 to n=2.
